results.firPara: Everton have rejected Milans offer to sign Gerard Deulofeu on loan but the Spain Under-21 internationals future at Goodison Park remains uncertain.
results.secPara: The Everton winger, who has fallen out of favour under Ronald Koeman, is a target for several clubs in Europe and the Premier League with Ajax the latest to register interest in signing the 22-year-old this month.
results.webTitle: Everton turn down Milan loan move for Gerard Deulofeu

results.firPara: The Sutton United manager, Paul Doswell, was so excited he didnt know which badge to kiss.
results.secPara: Their striker Roarie Deacon shook a joyous fist in the air. The defender Dean Beckwith was still ensconced with the travelling fans. So it was up to non-league Suttons celebrity fan, the comedian Tim Vine, to sum up this match with a simple one-liner. Sutton three, he said, Wimbledon one. Two teams who had felt slighted by a lack of interest from the TV cameras turned in a pulsating, full-blooded contest that was a throwback to classic FA Cup ties of the past. In the end Sutton replicated their giant-killing of 1989, when they knocked out top-flight Coventry City, with a late salvo of goals to beat a League One side who had been reduced to 10 men from the 11th minute.
results.webTitle: Sutton’s Maxime Biamou and Dan Fitchett strike late to stun Wimbledon in FA Cup

results.firPara: Such was the relief which swept around the smattering of local supporters at the final whistle it was tempting to suggest that, for all the exploits of Sutton United and Lincoln City, the real surprise from the nights FA Cup replays had actually been witnessed in this freezing corner of south-east London.
results.secPara: Crystal Palace have found victories so hard to come by in dire recent times that even a slender success over League One opposition is to be cherished. Indeed, with an impressive Bolton Wanderers side having led and later threatened to force extra-time, with Zach Clough poking just wide of a post, there was even a little instinctive punch of the air offered up by Sam Allardyce at the full‑time whistle. Manchester City will hardly be quaking in their boots at the prospect of visiting in the fourth round, but that is a concern for another day.
results.webTitle: Christian Benteke double inspires Crystal Palace win against Bolton

results.firPara: Jake Jervis was an intrepid footballing nomad until he settled at Home Park. As he prepares to take on Liverpool with Plymouth Argyle, his 11th club, in an FA Cup replay on Wednesday, the 25-year-old forward hopes to add a new highlight to a colourful career, ideally a win and goal to top the most satisfying – and most puzzling – he has scored to date.
results.secPara: That was in a 2-2 draw away against Fenerbahce, on his debut for Elazigspor, who in 2013 were in Turkeys top flight. It was a full house [in the 50,000-capacity Sukru Saracoglu Stadium] and the atmosphere was crazy, absolutely deafening, Jervis says. But when I scored it went totally quiet. Our fans were just in a tiny little section in the top corner and I couldnt hear them. I thought it must have been offside. It felt like a crazy experience and its been the highlight of my career so far.
results.webTitle: Plymouth’s Jake Jervis: ‘We’ve done the tough part in getting Liverpool here’

results.firPara: West Ham United have warned Dimitri Payet that they will not be pushed into selling him in the summer if he does not leave during the current transfer window, with the club doubtful whether Marseille will come up with an acceptable offer for the France international.
results.secPara: Despite Payets determination to return to the south of France as soon as possible, West Ham are insistent there is no financial pressure on them to sell a player whose deal runs out in 2021 and they are willing to bide their time until receiving a suitable fee from Marseille, whose second bid of £20m was turned down on Monday.
results.webTitle: West Ham warn Dimitri Payet there is no financial pressure to sell

results.firPara: Ghana held on to win their first Africa Cup of Nations game 1-0 against Uganda, thanks to an Andre Ayew penalty in the first half
results.secPara: Thatll be your lot from me. Cheers for reading, and take care of each out there.
results.webTitle: Ghana 1-0 Uganda: Afcon 2017 – as it happened

results.firPara: Diego Costa has taken his first step towards reintegration into the Chelsea squad following his spat with Antonio Conte by resuming training with the team, with the striker hoping to play his part in the title pursuit before departing in the summer.
results.secPara: Costa had been working on his own since complaining of pain in his lower back a week ago, prompting a row with a member of Chelseas fitness staff who had doubted the validity of the injury. Conte, who supported his coach, made Costa train alone and omitted him from the squad who beat Leicester City on Saturday. Chelsea were convinced the players attitude was born less of an injury and more of interest from the Chinese Super League club, Tianjin Quanjian.
results.webTitle: Diego Costa returns to Chelsea training but wants summer move

results.firPara: In todays Fiver Diego Costa, Juventus and an EU striker mountain
results.secPara: In todays Fiver Diego Costa, Juventus and an EU striker mountain
results.webTitle: The Fiver | Adding fuel to his ire fire

results.firPara: Tottenham Hotspur are braced to be without Jan Vertonghen for up to two months after the Belgium defender underwent scans on the ankle ligament injury sustained in Saturdays thrashing of West Bromwich Albion.
results.secPara: The tests on the joint revealed a tear lying between grades two and three, damage which had left Vertonghen in tears as he departed the turf at White Hart Lane and would normally rule him out at the very least until mid-March. Rehabilitation will begin once the swelling has receded on the left ankle and Mauricio Pochettino is preparing for life without the influential defender.
results.webTitle: Tottenham’s Jan Vertonghen facing up to two months out with ankle injury

results.firPara: Who are the reigning champions the Elephants, the Wild Beasts or the Horrors?
results.secPara: • Quiz how much do you know about the Africa Cup of Nations?
results.webTitle: Afcon 2017 nicknames quiz: do you know the Warriors from the Pharaohs?
